meanings.definition: A substance that is weakly attracted to a magnetic field.
meanings.sent1: The paramagnet was drawn towards the magnet.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the paramagnet's behavior in the magnetic field.
meanings.sent3: The paramagnet couldn't resist the pull of the magnet, always following it around.
meanings.sent4: Her love for him was like a paramagnet, irresistibly drawn to his magnetic personality.
meanings.sent5: The paramagnet danced in the magnetic field, twirling and spinning with joy.

meanings.sent1: The paramagnetism of the material was evident when it reacted to the magnetic field.
meanings.sent2: The paramagnet was carefully analyzed to understand its paramagnetism.
meanings.sent3: The paramagnetism in the material made it the star of the science fair.
meanings.sent4: His charm was like the paramagnetism of the material, attracting everyone around him.
meanings.sent5: The paramagnetism of the material was so strong, it seemed to have a life of its own.
